title: Patrice Evra picks his ultimate team-mate XI.. and says James Milner was his toughest opponent ever!
text:
Patrice Evra picked Carlos Tevez ahead of Wayne Rooney in his 'ulitmate' starting XI of former team-mates at Manchester United and Juventus, during his appearance on Sky Sports' Monday Night Football.

Evra was in the studio for Sheffield United's 1-0 victory over Arsenal, and spoke passionately and intelligently on a number of topics, including racism and the Luis Suarez incident of 2011-12.

The Frenchman, who played at Manchester United from 2006-2014, also surprisingly named James Milner as his toughest ever opponent, saying that he could 'deal with Lionel Messi.'

Patrice Evra was a guest panellist on Sky's coverage of Sheffield United vs Arsenal on Monday

Evra's team include seven United players, three Juve players and Tevez, who played for both

Goalkeeper: Edwin van der Sar

Dutch goalkeeper Edwin van der Sar played with Evra for five-and-a-half seasons, and they won two Champions Leagues and four Premier League titles together.

'Van der Sar is the only goalkeeper in the world who, when he makes a save, doesn't shout at his defenders,' said Evra.

'He was the captain of the defence, he was really calm, always talking to us and he was always in the right position.'

Defence: Dani Alves, Rio Ferdinand, Giorgio Chiellini, Patrice Evra

Dani Alves played with Evra briefly at Juventus, and the Frenchman was comical when questioned about why Alves was selected ahead of former Manchester United team-mate Gary Neville.

'I could have had Gary Neville, but Dani Alves is more talented!', said Evra, to the delight of fellow pundit Jamie Carragher.

Evra celebrates winning the Premier League in April 2013 - his last major trophy for United

'I love Gary and he was a consistent right-back, but Dani Alves is different quality.'

Elsewhere in the defence, Evra splits his centre-backs between England and Italy, with Rio Ferdinand and Giorgio Chiellini teaming up, while the 38-year-old obviously chose himself at left-back!

Midfield: Park Ji-Sung, Paul Scholes, Andrea Pirlo, Ryan Giggs

Perhaps the most surprising inclusion was former United workhorse Park Ji-Sung - Evra insisted that the South Korean never received the credit he deserved.

'He was a soldier,' said Evra.

'The 2008 Champions League semi-final against Barcelona, in both legs, he was man of the match. He didn't play the final after that but he is definitely one of my soldiers.'

Park Ji-Sung (pictured) often played ahead of Evra on the left-hand side for Manchester United

Andrea Pirlo, who Evra played with at Juventus for one season, makes the cut, and the Frenchman had some warm words to say about United stalwarts Paul Scholes and Ryan Giggs.

'When I joined Man Utd, a lot of people asked me who impressed me the most and people were always expecting me to say Wayne Rooney or Cristiano Ronaldo, but Giggs and Scholes were just amazing. They were role models.'

Forwards: Cristiano Ronaldo, Carlos Tevez

By the time Evra arrived at Manchester United from Monaco in January 2006, Cristiano Ronaldo had been at Old Trafford for two-and-a-half seasons.

The Portuguese has progressed to become one of the greatest players of all time, but is Evra surprised by the extraordinary level the Portuguese has reached?

'Not surprised. I remember when he won his first Ballon d’Or, he said he had to win five,' Evra explained.

'He is the most professional player I’ve ever played with. That's why when we compare him to Messi, I always choose him. Messi is just a gift. God tells him to go and play with us kids, but Cristiano works so hard.

Evra was full of praise for Cristiano Ronaldo, and rates him higher than rival Lionel Messi

'Before he signed for Juve, 20 minutes before, he called me about what it was about. He will still play until he is 40.’

The most notable omission is Wayne Rooney, who doesn't make the cut due to Carlos Tevez's inclusion.

'This one was a tough choice, Tevez or Wayne Rooney?' admitted Evra.

'But it comes from my heart, even if I am a close friend to Wayne... I played with Tevez in Manchester and Juventus, and what a player. He is a warrior and when we had him and Wayne up front, I was feeling sorry for the defenders.'

Manager: Sir Alex Ferguson

Unsurprisingly, Evra's manager for all but one season at Manchester United is his all-time coach.

'People respected Ferguson so much, I was scared of disappointing him. This was really important and we have such a close relationship. When I make a big decision, I definitely call him.'

Toughest opponent: James Milner

He picked James Milner as his toughest opponent due to their battles in the Manchester derby

However, the most startling admission from Evra was that he named James Milner as his toughest ever opponent, over Barcelona's Lionel Messi.

'He frustrated me because I’m an attacking defender. I was like 'just go on attack.'

'When I played the derby, I had him always up against me. Messi, I could deal with him.'
description: Patrice Evra named his 'ultimate' team-mate XI for clubs he's played at, and alongside a few surprising names on the list, he explained why James Milner was his toughest ever opponent.
